sub_topic: Riemann mapping theorem and its applications
message_1: What is the conformal map of the unit disk to the upper half-plane such that it maps 0 to i?
message_2:
A conformal map that maps the unit disk to the upper half-plane and sends 0 to i is given by the following MÃ¶bius transformation:

f(z) = i * (1 + z) / (1 - z)

This transformation preserves angles and maps the unit disk (|z| < 1) to the upper half-plane (Im(z) > 0) while sending the origin (0) to i.
